verdicts.reviewer_notes:
Investigation phase deliverable verified: The file-checker agent completed the simple investigation task as required. The agent:
1. Read real_mcp_server.py correctly
2. Counted deploy_claude_tmux_agent occurrences accurately (12 total)
3. Provided detailed breakdown by location/context
4. Reported completion status properly
5. Documented findings with specific line numbers

Phase success criteria met: Simple file check completed with accurate findings and proper documentation. No issues found.

observations.message: Agent completed the assigned task accurately - verified 12 calls to deploy_claude_tmux_agent with detailed breakdown by location and context
Task was trivial (simple file read + grep count) - doesn't justify full phase review process with 2 reviewers + 1 critique agent. This creates 3x agent overhead for a 30-second task

Phase-based review system needs calibration - trivial tasks (single file reads, simple counts) should bypass multi-agent review. Consider auto-approval threshold based on task complexity or agent execution time
Agent left 3 zombie processes (npm exec + tee + zsh) that weren't cleaned up properly. Auto-cleanup should handle process tree termination, not just tmux session
No handover document was created for this phase despite agent completion. Either handover creation should be automatic, or simple investigation phases shouldn't require handovers
Finding severity marked as 'low' is appropriate - this was informational data gathering, not issue discovery. Agent properly categorized the finding

critique.summary: Senior dev perspective: Agent executed task correctly with accurate findings (12 calls verified), but this exposes system inefficiency - spawning 3 review agents (2 reviewers + 1 critique) for a trivial 30-second task creates massive overhead. The orchestrator needs complexity-based review gating: simple tasks (file reads, grep counts) should auto-approve without multi-agent review. Also spotted process cleanup issue - 3 zombie processes remain despite auto-cleanup claiming success.
recommendations: Implement task complexity scoring (trivial/simple/moderate/complex) to determine review requirements
Auto-approve trivial tasks (<2 min execution, no code changes, informational only) without spawning reviewers
Fix process cleanup to kill entire process tree, not just tmux session
Make handover document creation automatic for all completed phases, or mark it optional for investigation-only phases
Consider adding execution time as a metric - if agent completes in <2 minutes with no errors, skip review

reviews.trigger_reason: All 1 phase agents finished (1 completed, 0 failed)
